Headline: Temporary #66 Westbound Reroute near Chicago/Monticello
ShortDescription: 66 Westbound buses are temporarily rerouted via  Chicago, Homan, Augusta, Pulaski and return to Chicago near Chicago/Monticello.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
#66 Westbound buses are temporarily rerouted via Chicago, Homan, Augusta, Pulaski and return to Chicago due to street blockage near Chicago/Monticello.

Eastbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Northbound #37 Sedgwick buses are temporarily rerouted via Wacker, LaSalle, Grand and Orleans due to street blockage near Wacker/Franklin.

Allow extra travel time.

Headline: #20 Madison Temporary Reroute at Madison/Lavergne
ShortDescription: 20 Madison buses are temporarily rerouted via Madison, Cicero, Washington, Laramie, and Madison, due to, Police activity  near Madison/Lavergne.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:

Headline: Red Line Service Delayed at Washington
ShortDescription: Red Line trains are standing at Washington due to an unauthorized person on the tracks. Crews working to restore service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Red Line trains are standing at Washington due to an unauthorized person on the tracks.

At this time, also consider other service alternatives that may serve your trip, such as nearby bus routes, or using buses to other rail lines. These may include: 

  • #3 King Drive
  • #4 Cottage Grove
  • #J14 Jeffrey Jump
  • #20 Madison
  • #29 State
  • #36 Broadway
  • #146 Inner Drive/Michigan Express
  • #148 Clarendon/Michigan

Shuttle buses are requested from Fullerton to Clark/Lake to provide connecting service in both directions.

Personnel are working to restore service. Allow extra travel time.

Headline: Red Line Subway Trains Rerouted to Elevated Tracks
ShortDescription: Red Line subway trains are rerouted to the elevated lines between Fullerton & Cermak-Chinatown due to due to an unauthorized person on the tracks at Washington.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
Red Line subway trains are rerouted to the elevated lines between Fullerton and Cermak-Chinatown due to due to an unauthorized person on the tracks at Washington.

We apologize for the inconvenience and are working to restore service as quickly as possible. Allow extra travel time.

Red Line service to 95th/Dan Ryan

After stopping at Fullerton, 95th-bound trains will be diverted and will make the following elevated station stops:

  • Armitage (accessible)
  • Sedgwick (accessible)
  • Chicago (at Franklin; accessible)
  • Merchandise Mart (accessible)
  • Clark/lake (accessible)
  • State/Lake
  • Washington/Wabash (accessible)
  • Adams/Wabash
  • Roosevelt (elevated station west of Wabash; accessible)

Then, trains will stop at Cermak-Chinatown and make all normal stops to 95th/Dan Ryan.

Red Line service to Howard

For service toward Howard, after stopping at Cermak-Chinatown, trains will then be diverted to the above-listed elevated stations, in the opposite order, through Armitage and then make all normal stops from Fullerton to Howard.

For service in areas away from where the Red Line is running

Consider using local bus alternatives through the area where you're traveling, including those to other train lines or where Red Line service has been rerouted to operate.

Shuttle buses are available between Fullerton and Clark/Lake to provide connecting service in both directions.
